{ HOUSING IN LEIGH AND BRANSFORD (2)
The changing pattern of agricul_ ture and employment has brought in its wake changes in housing. Many of the old farm workers' cottages have been bought by people moving into the area and have been extended and modernised. Barns and hop kilns are being convert_ ed into housing . Large houses, such as Cotheridge Court, are being renov_ ated and made into flats. The land belonging to Pigeonhouse Farm has recently been sold and the farm house turned over to residential use.
A number of farm houses and cottages date from the 17th and 18th centuries and are listed buildings.
